alert.note: Alert for Eastern Grant; Eastern Mineral; Eastern Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 3:19AM EST until March 12 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Northwest winds will gust around 45 to 55 mph, especially this afternoon. * WHERE...Central and eastern Allegany County in Maryland, eastern Grant, eastern Mineral, and eastern Pendleton Counties in West Virginia, and Page County in Virginia. * WHEN...Until 3 PM EST this afternoon. Snow will be steadiest through mid-morning before tapering off to a lighter snow later this morning into early this afternoon. Additional snow showers are possible, especially near the Allegheny Front this afternoon and evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility may be reduced to below one- quarter mile at times. Brief near blizzard conditions are possible. Snowfall rates around an inch per hour are expected this morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Grant; Eastern Mineral; Eastern Pendleton
